template: {CHARACTER_0} has 5 apples. If {CHARACTER_1} gives {CHARACTER_0} 3 more apples, how many apples does {CHARACTER_0} have in total?
{CHARACTER_0} collected 4 shiny rocks and {CHARACTER_1} collected 6 shiny rocks. How many rocks did they collect together?
{CHARACTER_0} baked 12 cookies in the morning and 8 cookies in the afternoon. How many cookies did {CHARACTER_0} bake in total?
{CHARACTER_0} had 15 balloons but 5 of them flew away. How many balloons does {CHARACTER_0} have now?
{CHARACTER_0} had 20 toys and gave 7 to {CHARACTER_1}. How many toys does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
{CHARACTER_0} has 3 bags with 4 candies in each bag. How many candies does {CHARACTER_0} have in total?
If {CHARACTER_0} plants 5 flowers in each row and has 3 rows, how many flowers are planted in total?
{CHARACTER_0} has 12 cookies to share equally among 3 friends. How many cookies does each friend get?
{CHARACTER_0} has 20 starfish to distribute equally into 4 buckets. How many starfish go in each bucket?
{CHARACTER_0} read 23 pages on Monday and 17 pages on Tuesday. {CHARACTER_1} read 19 pages. How many more pages did {CHARACTER_0} read than {CHARACTER_1}?
{CHARACTER_0} starts with 85 marbles. After losing 23 marbles to {CHARACTER_1}, how many does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
{CHARACTER_0} buys 7 boxes of crayons. Each box has 12 crayons. How many crayons does {CHARACTER_0} have in total?
A toy factory where {CHARACTER_0} works produces 15 toys per hour. How many toys are produced in 8 hours?
{CHARACTER_0} made 144 cookies and wants to pack them into 12 boxes equally. How many cookies go in each box?
{CHARACTER_0} has 256 coins to distribute equally among 8 friends. How many coins does each friend receive?
{CHARACTER_0} had 50 apples. {CHARACTER_0} gave 15 to {CHARACTER_1} and bought 20 more. How many apples does {CHARACTER_0} have now?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 87 points in the first game, 92 in the second, and 78 in the third. What is the total score across all three games?
{CHARACTER_0} has $500. After spending $123 on toys and $89 on books, how much money does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
{CHARACTER_0} works 25 days per month and earns $45 per day. How much money does {CHARACTER_0} earn in one month?
{CHARACTER_0} travels 540 kilometers in 9 hours. What is {CHARACTER_0}'s average speed per hour?
{CHARACTER_0} buys 8 books at $15 each and receives a $20 discount. How much does {CHARACTER_0} spend in total?
A library has 250 books. After {CHARACTER_0} donates 30 more books, if the books are arranged into 8 shelves equally, how many books are on each shelf?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 85 out of 100 on a test. What percentage did {CHARACTER_0} score?
A store is selling items at a 25% discount. If an item originally costs $80, what is the discounted price?
